overall_summary: The analysis demonstrates a practical approach to short-term forecasting with limited historical data (96 points). The reasoning combines statistical method consideration with pragmatic adaptation to data constraints, focusing on daily seasonality detection while acknowledging weekly pattern limitations. The final implementation uses simple averaging of available daily patterns due to insufficient data for complex seasonal models.
common_data_patterns: Potential weekly patterns (acknowledged but not modeled)
key_insights: Data limitation (4 days) forces simplification despite theoretical preference for SARIMA
Hourly averaging chosen over complex models due to insufficient seasonal cycles
Explicit trend analysis through daily averages calculation
Conscious handling of datetime features (hour/day recognition)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-stage evaluation: initial consideration of advanced statistical methods, detailed data pattern examination, and practical simplification. Combines theoretical model knowledge with hands-on data adaptation strategies.
